page.title: 01GENERAL VIEW OF OUR D-BLOCK
page.content: Our small village,situated at the north end of the D-Block has an important history, dating back to {Roman times.}Later in the 18th century the Mendips were important for the large quantities of{teazles}which grew here.These were needed for carding the local wool from Mendip sheep. Nowadays few families work at farming. Many of our parents go out of the village each day to work, as far as{Bath, Bristol, or even further. Most of the land of our D-Block is farmland or rough pasture, where cattle are grazed. The milk is sent away for{cheese making.}We also have one very large herd which gives the milk to be made into{yoghourt}just out of the village. We have walked from one end to the other of our D-Block and we passed only a few houses outside the village.
